skill.name: agile-product-owner
skill.description: Agile product ownership toolkit for Senior Product Owner including INVEST-compliant user story generation, sprint planning, backlog management, and velocity tracking. Use for story writing, sprint planning, stakeholder communication, and agile ceremonies.
skill.summary: Agile product ownership toolkit for Senior Product Owner including INVEST-compliant user story gener...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 37 static findings are false positives. The scanner incorrectly flagged Python dictionary access (`.get()`), method definitions, list iterations, and YAML text as security threats. This is a pure Python user story generator with no cryptographic code, network access, or dangerous patterns. The SKILL.md code fences are documentation, not shell execution. This skill is safe to publish.

content.user_title: Generate user stories and plan sprints
content.value_statement: Transform product ideas into INVEST-compliant user stories with automated acceptance criteria. Plan sprints with capacity metrics and prioritize backlog items based on business value and complexity.
actual_capabilities: Generate INVEST-compliant user stories from feature descriptions
Create automated acceptance criteria using Given-When-Then format
Plan sprints with capacity limits and stretch goals
Estimate story points based on complexity indicators
Prioritize backlog items by critical, high, medium, and low
limitations: Does not connect to external project management tools like Jira or Linear
Does not track sprint progress or burndown charts
Cannot import existing backlogs from files or APIs
Limited to predefined persona templates without customization

use_cases.title: Backlog Refinement
use_cases.description: Break down large features into manageable user stories with clear acceptance criteria

use_cases.title: Sprint Planning
use_cases.description: Calculate sprint capacity and select stories that fit within team velocity

use_cases.title: Story Estimation
use_cases.description: Get consistent story point estimates based on complexity indicators

prompt_templates.title: Generate Stories
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate user stories for a {feature_name} feature targeting {persona} users

prompt_templates.title: Acceptance Criteria
prompt_templates.prompt: Write acceptance criteria for a story about {feature_description}

prompt_templates.title: Plan Sprint
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan a sprint with {capacity} story points from this backlog: {story_list}

prompt_templates.title: Story Points
prompt_templates.prompt: Estimate story points for: {feature_description} with these requirements: {requirements}

output_examples.input: Generate user stories for a payment integration feature
output: Story: As a customer, I want to enter my payment details so that I can complete purchases securely
1. Given user has cart items, When they enter valid payment, Then payment processes
2. Should validate card information before processing
3. Must show clear error when payment fails

output_examples.input: Plan a sprint with 30 points capacity

best_practices: Break epics into stories with single, independent deliverables
Use INVEST criteria to validate story quality before sprint planning
Balance sprint capacity with 10-20 percent buffer for unexpected issues
anti_patterns: Creating stories that depend on other stories without clear dependencies
Writing vague stories without clear acceptance criteria
Overcommitting to sprint capacity without accounting for technical debt

faq.question: What is the INVEST criteria?
faq.answer: INVEST stands for Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, and Testable. These are quality standards for user stories.

faq.question: How are story points calculated?
faq.answer: Points are estimated based on complexity indicators like feature type, integration needs, and technical requirements.

faq.question: Can I customize persona templates?
faq.answer: The tool uses predefined personas. Edit the script to add custom personas for your specific use case.

faq.question: Does this integrate with Jira?
faq.answer: The tool generates stories in text format. Copy output to Jira manually or use JSON output for imports.

faq.question: What complexity words affect story points?
faq.answer: Simple, view, display reduce points. Create, edit increase points. Redesign, refactor, architect increase points significantly.

faq.question: How do stretch goals work?
faq.answer: Stories up to 20 percent over capacity are marked as stretch goals for optional inclusion in the sprint.
